etymology.description: semantic: 一(一) (yī, "one") + phonetic: 官(官) (guān, "official") -> two units of the same kind
etymology.interpretation: The character 两(兩) (liǎng, "two") combines 一(一) (yī, "one") to signify singular quantity, with 官(官) (guān, "official") denoting two of a kind, suggesting a pair or a couple of official units. This reflects its usage to count or refer to two items, particularly in contexts like weight (as in the traditional Chinese ounce or 'liang').
etymology.simplification: Traditional character 兩(兩) was simplified by reducing the complexity of components like 官(官) to a more cursive form without changing the fundamental elements, thus retaining semantic and phonetic associations.

examples.chinese: 我有两本书(我有兩本書)。
他买了两件衣服(他買了兩件衣服)，准备出门(準備出門)。
examples.pinyin: Tā mǎi le liǎng jiàn yīfú, zhǔnbèi chūmén.
examples.english: He bought two pieces of clothing and is ready to go out.

examples.chinese: 考题有两种答案(考題有兩種答案)，请选择正确的(請選擇正確的)。
examples.pinyin: Kǎotí yǒu liǎng zhǒng dá'àn, qǐng xuǎnzé zhèngquè de.
examples.english: The exam question has two types of answers; please choose the correct one.
